title: Katarina doing 60% of my hp at level 2 isn't right

replies.body: Only 60%? Then Kat fucked up. She should be killing you at lvl 2 if she's played correctly.
She's an assassin right?

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:33:43.599+0000)
>
> She's an assassin right?

So...?
Isn't that supposed to happen?
Idk most games I play her go like this early https://i.gyazo.com/dda657390f1ab3f460327f4304ff670c.gif  .. My win rate with her is bad but that still looks a bit too strong lol.

Nobody mentions the fact that ori 

1. Got pushed in by a melee for level 2 disadvantage.
2. Harassed you almost nothing for pushing that much early.
3. Started q vs melee (ewwww).
4. Didn't pop whatever her other sum was.

Ori misplayed that in just about every way possible, so of course she is going to die without a fight.

> [{quoted}](name=nm1010,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=00000000000000010001,timestamp=2017-01-10T02:54:12.022+0000)
>
> Nobody mentions the fact that ori 
> 
> 1. Got pushed in by a melee for level 2 disadvantage.
> 2. Harassed you almost nothing for pushing that much early.
> 3. Started q vs melee (ewwww).
> 4. Didn't pop whatever her other sum was.
> 
> Ori misplayed that in just about every way possible, so of course she is going to die without a fight.

You really think its alright for kat to have the kill potential of a lvl 1 tryndamere or a lvl 3 fizz in the laning phase????

Shes supposed to have a garbage lane because her roams are strong and she has resets on her kit, the fact she can kill ppl lvl 2 now is pretty much horribly broken, that would be like making nasus have 100-0 potential at lvl 2.

Riot blatanly stated when they reworked the assassins that they wanted to buff their early laning so that their midgame transition doesnt suck as much ass. If you've truly laned against even a good katarina your goal should be to harass but to pressure her for every creep. Her waveclear is non-existent without her primary damage spell, just as well both her dagger spells are her only means of resetting shunpo.

If's shes going exclusively for harass, punish her by shoving the wave in and resetting, if you cant do that then just start avoiding daggers altogether. Kat doesnt fall off as hard as the rest but a good amount of her damage is avoidable to some degree. if you walk forward when she q's she can miss the dagger damage. if she e-w's on top of you trade damage and try to avoid the q dagger when it lands. Abuse her weak level 1 where she legit has to walk to her q to proc the spin. heavily telegraphing where she's going to be.

Kat is strong but if you know how to fight her you can win.
Atm my favourite way to beat her is take Lux and take exhaust if she ever jumps me I can generally get a binding off and do a full combo on her

Basically any long range mage can shut her down if they have cc and if you take exhaust. I especially get triggered if the enemy support also has exhaust. 2 exhausts is a scary thing for a kat player, but a lot of people underestimate exhaust in the mid lane as a viable summoner spell.
iv stopped taking ignite mid since I just find exhaust and barrier to be plain better
What are you supposed to start against melee? Since Q is the only way to reposition the ball. Are you supposed to wait for them to walk up to you and try to W them or shield up?

You start e for the shield and resists, once the melee minions are dead (again you should be pushing) you can just zone the melee champion by autoing anytime they come into range and shielding the minion damage. 

> Are you supposed to wait for them to walk up to you

This is why I can't watch people play Orianna at low elo.

https://i.gyazo.com/fade35353a2770fcf17501b0ba78c2bb.png

That basically wins every trade at level 1 versus melee, you get upwards of 60-70 damage autos at level 1 with an extra 100 hp shield + the 10 extra armor and mr. So with your passive you will 100% win these level 1 fights every single time as Orianna.

> [{quoted}](name=Penns,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:49:37.295+0000)
>
> Idk most games I play her go like this early https://i.gyazo.com/dda657390f1ab3f460327f4304ff670c.gif  .. My win rate with her is bad but that still looks a bit too strong lol.

yea but shes not instakilling people, not only that ori never used any of her abilities in that fight and only flashed. 

bias
Yeah she's broken, but because her winrate is low people brush it off. Kat has a fairly high skill floor so not many can abuse her strength.

I wouldn't say she's broken, definitely strong if played correctly, which is much harder to do now. She still has the same inherent weaknesses as before, such as being heavily punished by cc. But because of her new kit a good kat player could set herself up to escape if she doesn't get focused while locked down, but then it comes down to her outplaying you. Thus accomplishing the point of the assassin reworks. Widen burst windows (which they most certainly accomplished on kat), give assassins more outplay potential (higher skill floor and cap) and make it so the enemies playing against them can say "I was outplayed" and not "there was nothing I can do". There is counter play to her kit, but people don't realize that a majority of her late game damage comes from her daggers as her Q and E don't scale that much on their own. If she can't pick up daggers or you avoid getting hit by them, a lot of her damage is gone. Her movements are also often highly telegraphed due to her need to pick up her daggers, skill shots now become easier to land because her enemies often have a good idea of where she will be shunpo'ing to next. Similar to draven, you see where his axe is gonna land so he will either have to drop the axe or take a Morgana Q to the face. I do believe she is strong, but I wouldn't say broken. If Riot chose to nerf her I would say base damage nerfs are the best way to go, cause to be honest I've already gone semi tanky builds with stuff like sun fire and still done a ton of damage and I don't want kat to turn into another tank Ekko monstrosity.

based on my experience Ill have to disagree.. sure she has to do all those things but it's at the point of, do I have point and click lock down, not just, do I have cc... cuz she jumps around far more than she did before and her damage is still very impressive when in the right hands..  I'm not saying she can't be beaten, in saying she's too slippery in most cases.

But once again, her being slippery requires her to plan her moves out and actually successfully reset shunpo. Only a really good kat player is gonna be able to be slippery enough to avoid numerous cc skill shots. Not to mention the fact of what kind of cc you have if any at all has nothing to do with whether or not she is too strong. It is one of her weaknesses but if you don't draft any hard cc after she's picked or she is picked because you didn't draft any hard cc is no different than any other draft strategy. People pick certain champs based on the enemy comp all the time. Olaf into a bunch of hard cc for example. Or sivir in a hard engage comp. So to say that if you don't have point and click cc then it's hard to kill her is kinda a lost argument cause if you don't have cc who's fault is that, not hers. So I guess the real argument is where do we draw the line between a champ being hard to play and how effective they are when someone knows how to play them well. Look at Azir and Kalista, both champs are hard to play but they ended up being too strong when played well and now they are both in the gutter. So I guess we have to assess whether kat is too good when played correctly. Personally If they were to nerf her I would say base damages could go down a little so she isn't too strong at lvl 3. And I think the auto reset on shunpo can go as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:33:43.599+0000)
>
> She's an assassin right?

but she's too strong right now

whats wrong with it?

is 50% ok? How about 40%? What amount and why?

Also how is she doing 60%

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:34:04.776+0000)
>
> whats wrong with it?
> 
> is 50% ok? How about 40%? What amount and why?
> 
> Also how is she doing 60%

I mean, it's very easy. Kat has probably one of the best level 2 (and level 3) all in in the whole game, rivaling even that of Yasuo.
Q on enemy laner > E behind enemy > AA if possible > Walk to dagger to proc > E on Enemy if possible. Ignite if present.
if you let her do all that she deserves to hurt you.
Most champions at this point don't really have a way to deal with someone who can blink on them twice.

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:34:04.776+0000)
>
> whats wrong with it?

Seems like he thinks it's a little much.
is 60% much? I mean at level 2 you shouldn't have much hp anyways and then its not like she does it from range or with sustained abilities or autoattacks.. or does she?

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:36:36.081+0000)
>
> is 60% much? I mean at level 2 you shouldn't have much hp anyways and then its not like she does it from range or with sustained abilities or autoattacks.. or does she?

I think so, it's about 300-400 health. She doesn't do it at range (actually she kinda does, just a little) but I don't see why it would matter if it was from sustained abilities or autos?
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Isjgc0oX0s
You standing in the vicinity of her daggers is exactly why Boards should have 0 say when it comes to game balance.

The spin is in a circle around Katarina when she picks it up, not in a circle around the dagger. So if she Q E s you, unless you run TOWARDS her you will get hit by her spin, and if you to her original location that is 1-2 extra Auto attacks she can get off, which means you are taking the same amount of damage unless you use summoners
They cry about everything. There is a guy who was whinning about not surviving a Lux combo as an adc. Boards are a meme forest.
Seems right to me. An Assassin being able to deal 60% of your HP with a full combo at Level 2 seems ok to me.
Level two you have access to only half your kit, that shit ain't a full combo.
How about you don't stand on the dagger?

> [{quoted}](name=nm1010,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:34:44.699+0000)
>
> How about you don't stand on the dagger?

she can dash onto it before it lands.
It lands 350 units behind the target she q'd, the spin has a 340 unit hitbox. Unless you literally walk on to it she can't hit you with both q and e dagger.
Well then where do you run tho? Into her to die too or the the side which doesnt do anything early game either?
If you run into her then she has no damage, smart one. You might take an auto but I doubt that would hurt you too much.

> [{quoted}](name=Cowseed,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-09T23:01:53.610+0000)
>
> If you run into her then she has no damage, smart one. You might take an auto but I doubt that would hurt you too much.

AHAHAHAHA Autos are an essential part of her damage early on. Add Long Sword start (or Dark Seal start > Double long sword first back) + AD reds + Ignite, and she can get on just fine with Autos against most mages until her cooldowns come back if she hasn't scared them off. As Katife put it in one of his gameplay analysis, AD is important early on, AP is important later.

Wait.
You need two long swords after the first back?
I mean, I always start Dark Seal start, but about AD, I didn't thought about that.

> [{quoted}](name=Edenn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-12T22:08:17.138+0000)
>
> Wait.
> You need two long swords after the first back?
> I mean, I always start Dark Seal start, but about AD, I didn't thought about that.

I mean, you do you, you don't "need" anything, but yes, early on AD is better for Kat because it makes farming easier (especially considering most of your matchups can one way or another zone you off CS, even melee matchups) and her autos are a large part of her early trades and combos, and the long swords build into Hextech Gunblade anyways.

I start Dark Seal too. I didn't like the long sword start when I tried it out, but others make it work, notably Redmercy.

I actually always get defensive stats + AP on my first back.

I just tried early AD for a few games, it's way better like that.
Eh.
At least I'm improving to get out of elohell if I can.

> [{quoted}](name=Edenn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-14T05:37:25.751+0000)

> 
> I just tried early AD for a few games, it's way better like that.

> At least I'm improving to get out of elohell if I can.

Getting some defensive early never hurts.

If I'm up against say Annie, Syndra, Yasuo, etc. who can kill even if I got the first kill in lane, I would usually get long sword + fitting defensive base item + pots.

Point still stands. Early AD on Kat is really good due to auto attacks and AD ratios on daggers and shunpo.

I always start long sword + her E has 65% total AD scaling + its an aa reset. That does hurt a lot, you dont even need to hit 1 dagger level 2 to pretty much win every all in as long as you pick it up for the e reset.

You kite her like you would any moronic melee champ that early. Diagonally away from her and her minions, if she tries to force an aa fight without dagger damage your minions win the trade almost by themselves.

> [{quoted}](name=nm1010,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-09T20:34:44.699+0000)
>

I agree with this to a point. Her dagger aoe range is very deceptive and seems to hit you when you're no where near it.
I got used to it after playing vs Kat 1-2 games, it is definitely something you can get familiar with.
So does {{champion:91}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:34}} among other things
Lux depends on skillshots. And no she doesnt take 60% of your hp at level 2.

> [{quoted}](name=Chelleyon,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BP7t6xzc,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2017-01-10T11:20:31.428+0000)
>
> Lux depends on skillshots. And no she doesnt take 60% of your hp at level 2.

Yep, Lux Q auto E auto + TLD doesn't do 60% of your health.

It literally doesn't. Q: 50 + (70% ), E: 60 + (60%), Auto attack: 55 (estimated) + Passive: 30 + (20% AP) + TLD: 20 + (10% AP). Assuming 30 AP, that's about 263 damage pre-resists. Given that most mid laners would have close to around 600 HP at level 2 (660 if they have Doran's), then no, it doesn't do 60% of your health.
